/rna-seq/others/about/.title: About others
/rna-seq/others/about/.body: This is an about page for “others” in the collections.

/rna-seq/pages/how_I_build_this_website/.title: How I build this website
/rna-seq/pages/how_I_build_this_website/.body: This website is powered by jekyll-gitbook [https://github.com/sighingnow/jekyll-gitbook]. I simply forked the repository from the github and pasted them into my own repo. For local procedures, I use docker-ed jekyll. Here is my typicall command for a quick check after updating markdown. JEKYLL_VERSION=4.2.0 docker run --rm \ --volume="$PWD:/srv/jekyll:Z" \ --publish 127.0.0.1:4000:4000 \ -it jekyll/jekyll:$JEKYLL_VERSION \ sh -c "cd /srv/jekyll/rna-seq && bundle install && jekyll serve"

/rna-seq/rna-seq/2024-08-23-easy_rna-seq.title: How you can obtain easy-to-handle data without bioinformatician
